column2: Displays the total amount of free space available along with the amount of memory used and swap memory in the system and also the buffers used by the kernel
It is a user information lookup command which gives details of all the users logged in.
Used to find files and directories and perform subsequent operations on them
Clears the terminal screen
Used to exit the shell where it is currently running
Used to display line of text/string that are passed as an argument
Searches a file for a particular pattern of characters and displays all lines that contain that pattern
Used to display information related to file systems about total space and available space
Changes ownership of a file or directory
Instructs the shell to replace one string with another string while executing the commands
Concatenates files or output a file
Changes the access mode of a file or directory
Shows who are logged in
Shows real-time stats of system process and hardware usage
Used to manually terminate a process
Lists running processes and their PIDs
Invokes a makefile that tells compiler how to compile a project
The C compiler by GNU used to compile C files
The C++ compiler by GNU used to compile C++ files
Displays the manual page for a command-line utility
Secure copy a file or directory over network
Secure shell used for remoting into other computers using TLS
Moves file or directory to a destination
Copies a file or directory to a destination
General purpose utility that can remove files symbolic links and directories
Removes a directory
